alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 3:02PM EDT until July 21 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norton has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Worcester County in central Massachusetts... Northeastern Franklin County in western Massachusetts... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2.5 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low- lying areas. Sharp rises on creeks and streams to over bankfull is possible. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Orange, Deerfield, Athol, Montague, Sunderland, Northfield, Bernardston, Leverett, Erving, Shutesbury, Gill, Royalston, New Salem, Wendell and Warwick. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
